thread.title: Taking off: what's new in the world
thread.title_full: Taking off: what's new in the world | The Sunday Times

author: The Sunday Times
title: Taking off: what's new in the world
text:
Happy days at the beach with the new sunlounger trolley Don’t just lie there
Sick of traipsing over the dunes with armfuls of beach gear while your partner vacillates over the ideal spot? This new sunlounger trolley should avert the customary row. It allows you to smoothly haul up to 20kg of beach-related gubbins such as spades, towels and windbreaks across the sand. Then you get to take the weight off by converting it into a sunbed. It cones with a headrest pillow and sunshade, and is available in three colours. Definitely a sunlounger worth reserving.
From £46; rollonsummer.co.uk
Every cloud
Drinking out of a glass is so last year. Instead, how about inhaling a cloud of vaporised cocktail? Alcoholic Architecture, a temporary bar opening this month in Borough Market, south London, is offering you the chance to do just that. Select your tipple, watch as it’s vaporised using powerful humidifiers, then imbibe it by breathing in. You’ll also absorb
